publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: THE AVTHORS OF this booke touching the diffe∣rence betweene their Apologie & the libels therin impugned.

monogr.title: A briefe apologie, or defence of the Catholike ecclesiastical hierarchie, & subordination in England : erected these later yeares by our holy father Pope Clement the eyght; and impugned by certayne libels printed & published of late both in Latyn & English; by some vnquie persons vnder the name of priests of the seminaries. VVritten and set forth for the true information and stay of all good Catholikes, by priests vnited in due subordination to the Right Reuerend Archpriest, and other their superiors
monogr.author: Parsons, Robert

div.head: THE AVTHORS OF this booke touching the difference betweene their Apologie & the libels therin impugned.
div.p: SApitisne inter verum falsumve discernere? inter inflatum & solidum? inter tutbidum & tranquillum? inter tumidum & sanum? inter probationes & criminationes? inter documenta & figmenta? inter causae actionem, & causae auersionem? si sapitis, benè & rectè; si autem non sapitis, nos vestri curam gessisse non poenitebit, quia etsi cor vestrum ad •• cem non conuertitur, pax nostra tamen ad nos reuertitur.

DO yow know to distinguish betweene true and false? betweene solide and puffed vp? betweene turbulent, and quiet? betweene swelling and sound? betweene probations and criminations? betweene instructions and fictions? betweene handling the cause, & running frō the cause? if yow know this, wel and good, If yow know it not we are not sorie, that we haue had this care to instruct yow, for albeit your harte be not turned to peace, yet our peace returneth to vs.
